column4: Your CPU has gone through one of its billions of cycles it does in a second. You must reboot for it to take effect. I used resource hacker to change that dialog, can't remember which exe I edited, it was long ago
it'd be sweet if linux could run a swapping kernel, so that it can step in while a kernel swap takes place, more uptime as no need to reboot between kernel upgrades :)
Yes it would. I would never reboot again. Do you know any OS that can swap kernels while running?
unfortunately not but it's definately the future
